docs.lead_paragraph: A lower court had found that the law, which limits the availability of medicinal, nonsurgical abortions, had imposed an undue burden on women.

headline.main: Supreme Court Lets Decision on Arizona Abortion Law Stand

docs.abstract: Supreme Court lets stand decision by lower court temporarily blocking Arizona law restricting medicinal, nonsurgical abortions.
docs.snippet: A lower court had found that the law, which limits the availability of medicinal, nonsurgical abortions, had imposed an undue burden on women.

docs.lead_paragraph: A regional U.S. federal appeals court ruled on Monday that pornographic movie actors in Los Angeles must wear condoms during sex scenes, upholding a lower court decision that was challenged by the adult film industry.

headline.main: Los Angeles Porn Actors Must Wear Condoms, Appeals Court Rules
headline.print_headline: Los Angeles Porn Actors Must Wear Condoms, Appeals Court Rules

docs.snippet: A regional U.S. federal appeals court ruled on Monday that pornographic movie actors in Los Angeles must wear condoms during sex scenes, upholding a lower court decision that was challenged by the adult film industry.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Los Angeles County ordinance requiring actors in pornographic films to use condoms does not violate the porn industry's First Amendment rights of free expression, a federal appeals court ruled Monday.

headline.main: Appeals Court Upholds Condom Use in LA Porn Films
headline.print_headline: Appeals Court Upholds Condom Use in LA Porn Films

docs.snippet: A Los Angeles County ordinance requiring actors in pornographic films to use condoms does not violate the porn industry's First Amendment rights of free expression, a federal appeals court ruled Monday.

headline.main: Live Chat: Prenatal Screening: When a Result Is Not a Diagnosis

docs.abstract: Join me and New England Center for Investigative Reporting’s Elizabeth Daley, along with experts Dr. Kecia Gaither and Athena Cherry this afternoon, Dec. 15, 2014, from 2 p.m. to 3 p.m. Eastern time, for a live chat about the reliability of prenatal screenings.
docs.snippet: Join me and New England Center for Investigative Reporting’s Elizabeth Daley, along with experts Dr. Kecia Gaither and Athena Cherry this afternoon, Dec. 15, 2014, from 2 p.m. to 3 p.m. Eastern time, for a live chat about the reliability of...

headline.main: Prenatal Testing: When a Result Is Not a Diagnosis

docs.abstract: An investigative report found that doctors and patients are misinterpreting new prenatal tests and failing to understand how often a positive screen can be a false alarm.
docs.snippet: An investigative report found that doctors and patients are misinterpreting new prenatal tests and failing to understand how often a positive screen can be a false alarm.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court is refusing to allow Arizona to enforce stringent restrictions on drug-induced abortions while a challenge to those rules plays out in lower courts.

headline.main: Justices Reject Arizona Bid Over Abortion Drugs
headline.print_headline: Justices Reject Arizona Bid Over Abortion Drugs

docs.snippet: The Supreme Court is refusing to allow Arizona to enforce stringent restrictions on drug-induced abortions while a challenge to those rules plays out in lower courts.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday blocked Arizona from enforcing a state law that restricts access to abortion-inducing drugs by prohibiting off-label uses of RU-486, the so-called "abortion pill."

headline.main: Top Court Rejects Arizona Appeal Over Abortion Drug Law
headline.print_headline: Top Court Rejects Arizona Appeal Over Abortion Drug Law

docs.snippet: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday blocked Arizona from enforcing a state law that restricts access to abortion-inducing drugs by prohibiting off-label uses of RU-486, the so-called "abortion pill."

docs.lead_paragraph: For many women, midwives offer good, cost-effective maternity care. There is no reason that their role should not be expanded.
docs.abstract: Editorial asserts midwives should have more prominent role in childbirth in United States, citing studies showing certified nurse midwives do as well or better than obstetricians for low-risk deliveries; urges Congress to pass pending legislation that would identify areas of US with shortages of maternity care professionals and formulate plans to close gaps.
docs.snippet: For many women, midwives offer good, cost-effective maternity care. There is no reason that their role should not be expanded.
